item.title: 2022.EuroSEAS_(dan abstract)
item.description: see: 000.personal.bio 2022.EuroSEAS_(panel submission) 034.Chapter4_Transnational virtual networks Finding home and community in virtual third places: The returns of Western-born Vietnamese Abstract Since the 1986 Doi Moi reform, an increasing number of labour migrants and students leave Viet Nam every year for better opportunities abroad. During the same period, a positive correlation can be seen with members of the diaspora returning to the country.

item.title: EuroSEAS
item.description: See also: - [[_Spaces/work/Conferences/2022.Conferences]] - [[Spaces/work/Conferences/2022.EuroSEAS(dan presentation)]] European Association for Southeast Asian Studies (EuroSEAS) EuroSEAS Paris, France 28 th June â€“ 1 st July 2022 https://www.euroseas.org/ Founded in 1992, the European Association for Southeast Asian Studies (EuroSEAS) aims to stimulate scholarly cooperation within Europe in the field of Southeast Asian studies. Our main activity is the organization of a biennial international conference bringing together hundreds of specialists on Southeast Asia from all over the world.

item.title: Journal of Enthnic and Migration Studies
item.description: Journal of Ethnic and Migration Studies https://www.tandfonline.com/toc/cjms20/current Aims and Scope The Journal of Ethnic and Migration Studies (JEMS) publishes the results of first-class research on all forms of migration and its consequences, together with articles on ethnic conflict, discrimination, racism, nationalism, citizenship and policies of integration. Contributions to the journal, which are all fully refereed, are especially welcome when they are the result of original empirical research that makes a clear contribution to the field of migration

item.title: Journals to publish in
item.description: see also [[How to write a panel proposal]] In conversation with phi hong su publish in very high journals with intention that paper would be rejected but with great commentary. fix paper and then submit to lower tier journal. journalguide.com verge (minnesota uni press) Transitions: Journal of Transient Migration crossings: journal of migration migration letters (3-4k words) Diaspora: A Journal of Transnational Studies (toronto) social identities journal of immigrant and refugee studies global networks journal (wiley and max-planck) Qualitative Sociology (springer) 35 days median to first decision Journal of Immigrant and Refugee Studies 33% acceptance journal of international migration and integration (JIMI) Identities 33% acceptance AJS JSR socius JEMS Ethnic racial studies amerasia journal Journal of Vietnamese Studies journal of gender studies International Migration Review (slow and Don’t do this per phi) social media + society
